column3: str

Kageel Ja is pondering a new beverage.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Deliver the requested materials to Kageel Ja.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),16))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Mine <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> near the dirigible landing<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),17))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> near Yak Awak Tsoly<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),18))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Catch <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> at Yak Awak Tsoly<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/></If></If></If>.
Hmmm, mixing in the more colorful vegetables might make the juice more appetizing... Oh, and we could try adding ingredients from the upper forest.
Hmmm, maybe instead of just mashing the vegetables, we could strain them through cloth or boil them down into a stock...?
We need a drink that pairs well with the tiika selvaas. Maybe something smooth with a rich flavor...? In which case, it might be best to serve it hot...

We need a drink that pairs well with the Yak T'el salad and the stewed ty'aitya...and somehow also that suspicious-yet-popular soup. Perhaps a lighter beverage? Or maybe lean into an even spicier concoction?
...Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Sorry, I was just thinking about a new beverage we could serve at the kitchen.
Are you busy at the moment? If not, I could use your help procuring the less common ingredients I have in mind...
Specifically, a few bottles of spring water drawn from the reserves north of the dirigible landing. Chilled or heated, it's known for its smooth and clear taste.
Specifically, a few baskets of leopardfang tea leaves harvested from the area around Yak Awak Tsoly. It's not the easiest variety to brew, but I hear patience is rewarded with a most flavorful tea.
Specifically, a certain tea grass hauled up from Yak Awak Tsoly. I hear it has a rich and full-bodied flavor, bursting with the blessings of the cenote.
Yet only skilled fishers are able to use golden stonefly nymphs to snag the grass and fish up this precious treasure. I am, however, fully confident that you're up to the task.
If you don't mind, I'll need a few bottles of spring water drawn from the reserves north of the dirigible landing in the upper forest.
If you don't mind, I'll need a few baskets of leopardfang tea leaves harvested from the area around Yak Awak Tsoly.
If you don't mind, I'll need a certain tea grass hauled up from Yak Awak Tsoly. It's a little difficult to procure, but golden stonefly nymphs should help you with the task.
Do you have the ingredient I asked for?
Yes, this is wonderful quality─as will be the beverage our kitchen makes with it.
A juice stall in Tuliyollal, you say? I'd like to work with this Boonewa someday and see what colorful and delectable drinks we might create.
Cooking is a fine art, but I see now the world of possibility in making drinks. I can't wait to try out different mixes and enjoy them alongside our foods!

Imagine Gok Golma becoming a place where people from all over the nation come to relax─a place where they share their favorites from the menu, and make plans to return time and again. Wouldn't that be nice?
